thinking.disposable_income: Mid-West has a moderate median household income around $55,000, with about 20% of residents living below poverty level, indicating varied but generally constrained disposable income levels.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: The area has mixed-income households with moderate discretionary spending capacity, though many residents are price-sensitive to additional taxes and fees.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has good road access but limited transit options, with most residents relying on personal vehicles, though there is growing demand for better transit connectivity to major employment centers.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized proposals with lower sales tax (0.5-1.0%) to protect discretionary income 2) Favored moderate transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to keep transit affordable while maintaining service quality 3) Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to encourage transit use without overly burdening car-dependent residents 4) Selected proposals that achieve meaningful travel time improvements for both modes 5) Balanced revenue generation for transit improvements with household budget impacts
